newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines' Reynolds plans aluminium cans plant.
newsitem.headline: Philippines' Reynolds plans aluminium cans plant.

text.p: Aluminium producer Reynolds Philippine Corp plans to build a plant to produce aluminium cans, company president Jaime Gonzales said on Tuesday.
The plant will cater to the needs of the country's biggest brewers San Miguel Corp and Asia Brewery Inc, he said.
San Miguel has a packaging division which makes aluminium cans. With an installed capacity of 450 million units a year, it is at present the only aluminium cans maker in the country.
Gonzales said Reynolds was getting into aluminium cans because of an expected surge in demand.

"It's a major growth area for us," he said, adding: that total aluminium demand in the country could grow to 50,000 to 60,000 tonnes per year in 1999 from the current 25,000 tonnes, with the growth primarily coming from cans.
Gonzales said the new plant was estimated to cost between $25 million and $30 million.
The plant is expected to be completed in 1999 when demand for aluminium cans is expected to grow to 1.7 billion units a year, equivalent to 2,000 tonnes a month, he said.
The company did not give capacity details of the new plant.

Reynolds is making an initial public offering of shares which is due to open on Wednesday. It will offer 238 million shares at 4.55 pesos each. Proceeds of the IPO will be used to retire debt, the company said.
